meanings.definition: The quality of lacking persuasiveness or credibility.
meanings.sent1: The unconvincingnesses of his argument made it hard to believe.
meanings.sent2: Her story was full of unconvincingnesses, so no one trusted her.
meanings.sent3: The unconvincingnesses of the magician's tricks made the audience chuckle.
meanings.sent4: The unconvincingnesses of his excuses were as clear as day.
meanings.sent5: The unconvincingnesses of the conspiracy theory left everyone skeptical.

meanings.definition: The state of being unconvincing or not believable.
meanings.sent1: The unconvincingnesses of the plot made the movie boring.
meanings.sent2: In court, the unconvincingnesses of the witness's testimony were evident.
meanings.sent3: The unconvincingnesses of the politician's promises were disappointing.
meanings.sent4: The unconvincingnesses of the situation hit him like a ton of bricks.
meanings.sent5: The unconvincingnesses of the ghost story gave her chills.
